item.title: February Ties Reord-Low for Artic Sea Ice
item.description: Even as the ice in the Arctic continues to form as part of the normal winter cycle, the cycle is continuing to show signs of anything but normalcy.

item.title: 9 iPad Apps to Help You Go Paperless
item.description: Go beyond reading your newspaper. These apps help you cook a meal, write a poem, manage your to-do lists â€“ and even sign business contracts.

item.title: The Best Electric and Hybrid Rental Cars
item.description: Electric cars like the Nissan Leaf and Chevy Volt are now available as rental cars, as are a host of hybrids

item.title: Is Natural Gas as Good for the Environment as They Say?
item.description: Relative to coal and alternative fuels, are carbon dioxide emissions from natural gas low enough to avert global warming?

item.title: A Clean Energy Standard has Fans on Both Sides of the Aisle, But...
item.description: There's a rare chance to pass a meaningful bipartisan energy bill to support renewable energy on a large scale, but the obstacles are great.

item.title: How to Pay 80 Cents a Gallon (Or Less) for Gas
item.description: Instability in Libya, Egypt and throughout the Mideast has sent gas prices well north of $3 a gallon. Try these 5 road-tested ways to save money on gas.

item.title: Should Smoking Be Banned in Parks?
item.description: New York City's Mayor Michael Bloomberg has signed a law banning smoking in city parks. Do you think smoking in parks should be banned?

item.title: Touring the Real Cape Point
item.description: Searching for authenticity and learning about the environment on a tour of one of South Africa's premiere destinations, without getting caught in any tourist traps

item.title: From Barely Green to Practically Green?
item.description: New site aims to make green living manageable.

item.title: Study: More Climate Change = More Pollen = Worse Allergies
item.description: The northern half of North America is getting sneezier, snifflier and itchier.
